action.action-desc: Mr. Emmer of Minnesota (for himself, Mr. Kline, and Mr. Fortenberry) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To provide enhanced security at Armed Forces recruitment centers through the installation of reinforced bullet-proof glass and entry doors.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Armed Forces Career Center Protection Act.

section.header: Installation of reinforced bullet-proof glass and entry doors at Armed Forces recruitment centers
section.text: The Secretary of each of the military departments, and the Secretary of the Department in which the Coast Guard is operating, shall provide for the installation of reinforced bullet-proof glass and entry doors at Armed Forces recruitment centers, including facilities leased for use as recruitment centers, under the jurisdiction of the Secretary as an additional security measure to protect members of the Armed Forces serving as recruiters and potential recruits and other individuals visiting recruitment centers.
